Package edu.ntnu.idatt1002.group12.flus.controller

Class AccountRegister

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt1002.group12.flus.controller.AccountRegister
public class AccountRegister extends Object
The class represents a registry of user accounts. It provides methods to register, delete, and modify accounts, as well as to retrieve account information.
Since:
April 17, 2023.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ramtin Samavat and Stian Lyng

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AccountRegister getInstance()
      Returns an instance of the AccountRegister class. If an instance does not exist, a new instance is created.
      Returns:
      an instance of the AccountRegister class.

    • findAccount

      protected Account findAccount(String username) throws NullPointerException, NoSuchElementException
      The method is a helper method for the other methods in the class. It retrieves an account from the list of accounts with username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account.
      Returns:
      the account to be retrieved.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the username is null.
      NoSuchElementException - if the account does not exist.

    • registerAccount

      public void registerAccount(String username, String password, String email, String phoneNumber) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullPointerException
      The method registers a new account with the provided information.
      Parameters:
      username - The desired username for the new account. Must be unique.
      password - The password for the account.
      email - The email address for the new account. Must be unique.
      phoneNumber - The phone number for the new account. Must be unique.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an account with the same information already exists.
      NullPointerException

    • deleteAccount

      public boolean deleteAccount(String username, String inputValidation) throws NullPointerException
      The method removes an account from the list of accounts based on the provided information.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account to be deleted.
      inputValidation - input validation for deletion i form of username.
      Returns:
      true if the account was successfully deleted, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either the username or inputValidation is null.

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String username, String oldPassword, String newPassword) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullPointerException, NoSuchElementException
      The method changes the password of an existing account.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account.
      oldPassword - the old password of the account.
      newPassword - the new password of the account.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the old or new password is invalid.
      NullPointerException - if the old or new password is null.
      NoSuchElementException - if the account does not exist.

    • changeEmail

      public void changeEmail(String username, String newEmail) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullPointerException, NoSuchElementException
      The method changes the email of an existing account.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account.
      newEmail - the new email for the account.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new email is not valid.
      NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
      NoSuchElementException - if the account does not exist.

    • changePhoneNumber

      public void changePhoneNumber(String username, String newPhoneNumber) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullPointerException, NoSuchElementException
      The method changes the phone number of an existing account.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account.
      newPhoneNumber - the new phone number for the account.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new phone number is not valid.
      NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
      NoSuchElementException - if the account does not exist.

    • getAccount

      public Account getAccount(String username, String password) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      The method retrieves a deep copy of the Account object corresponding to the specified username and password.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account.
      password - the password of the account.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the Account object corresponding to the specified username and password.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either the username or password is null
      NoSuchElementException - if the account does not exist.
      UnsupportedOperationException - if cloning is not supported.
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getAccounts

      protected List<Account> getAccounts()
      The method retrieves the list of accounts.
      Returns:
      the list of accounts.

    • saveAccounts

      public void saveAccounts(String pathOfFile) throws IOException, NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Saves the list of accounts to the ACCOUNTS_STORE file. Creates a new file if the file does not exist. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      pathOfFile - the path of the file to save the accounts to.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException if an I/O error occurs.
      NullPointerException - if pathOfFile is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if pathOfFile is blank or does not end with FILE_EXTENSION.

    • loadAccounts

      public void loadAccounts(String pathOfFile) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, EOFException, NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Loads the list of accounts from the ACCOUNTS_STORE file. Annotated with @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") because we know that the file contains a list of accounts.
      Parameters:
      pathOfFile - the path of the file to load the accounts from.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found.
      EOFException - if the file is either empty or corrupted.
      NullPointerException - if pathOfFile is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if pathOfFile is blank or does not end with FILE_EXTENSION.
